metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3430 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dovecot 1.1 before 2.2.13 and dovecot-ee before 2.1.7.7 and 2.2.x before 2.2.12.12 does not properly close old connections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via an incomplete SSL/TLS handshake for an IMAP/POP3 connection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.1').
